title: JS Tech Talk[Online]:What would the browser do? Simpler mental models with Remix
details:
Details
-------

ðŸ™Œ TorontoJS tech talks are now online!

**TorontoJS Tech Talk \[Online\]** welcomes you to an electrifying virtual gathering where tech enthusiasts unite! Prepare for an immersive experience focused on cutting-edge tech talks, insightful discussions, and vibrant connections. Our highlight? A captivating presentation led by our esteemed guest host. Join us as they lead the way through an evening of curiosity, collaboration, and a deep dive into the world of JavaScript and beyond. Elevate your tech journey with us, and be part of an engaging experience where passion for code meets the thrill of learning.

ðŸ‘‹ Come out and join us with special guest Andre who will lead a talk on [Remix, a full-stack web framework.](https://remix.run/)

**Schedule:**

**6:00 pm** - Introduction & welcome notes from TorontoJS  
**6:10 pm** - Andre Landgraf: What would the browser do? Simpler mental models with Remix  
**6:35 pm** - Question Period and or mob programming  
**7:00 pm** - Networking  
**7:25 PM** - Final words

**[Andre Landgraf](https://%5Bhttps://andrelandgraf.dev/%5D\(https://andrelandgraf.dev/\))** is a web developer from Germany. Currently, he lives in Cupertino, California, and works as a Software Engineer at LinkedIn. Andre loves learning, writing, and speaking about all things web. In his free time, he tutors aspiring developers, attends and organizes tech meetups, and builds cool web apps.

Andre is a frequent speaker at [conferences](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E93O9GEAahk) speaking about topics ranging from React and his current passion: [Remix](https://remix.run/)

Andre is the author of [Full Stack Development With Remix](https://www.amazon.com/Full-Stack-Development-Remix-production-ready/dp/1801075298)

**We look forward to seeing you!**

The event will be held on the [TorontoJS Discord server](https://discord.gg/q34aKj2XXh?event=1178448409355628626)[.](https://discord.gg/kgghh7q6?event=1178448409355628626)

We're looking for sponsors for events like these.

If you or your company would like to support TorontoJS and get a message out to our community, please get in touch with \[[organizers@torontojs.com](http://organizers@torontojs.com)\]([mailto:organizers@torontojs.com](http://mailto:organizers@torontojs.com))

[Code of Conduct](https://torontojs.com/p/code_of_conduct) is enforced at all TorontoJS events and spaces online or in person.
